item.title: Deepak Vashishth Named CEPM Co-Director
item.description: Deepak Vashishth, Ph.D., Director of the Shirley Ann Jackson, Ph.D. Center for Biotechnology and Interdisciplinary Studies (CBIS) and Yamada Corporation Chaired Professor of Biomedical Engineering, has been named the RPI Co-Director of the Center for Engineering and Precision Medicine (CEPM) in New York City.
item.author: Community

item.title: DotCIO Announces Next Phase of AFS Retirement
item.description: As previously announced, Andrew File System (AFS), a legacy file storage system, needs to be retired to maintain an acceptable cybersecurity posture for the Institute. The service will be retired in stages and sunsetting completely in September 2024. Among affected services, AFS housed all content for homepages.rpi.edu and dept.rpi.edu. The next stage of this process, access to departmental and personal AFS space (homepages/dept), will be discontinued on June 5, 2024.

item.title: Save the Date for This Year’s Annual Lavender Graduation!
item.description: Date: Thursday, May 16, 2024 3:00 PM - 4:30 PM - The campus community is welcome to join Rensselaer’s LGBTQ+ Task Force for the 7th Annual Lavender Graduation to help celebrate our LGBTQ+ graduates! Graduating students, please register if you plan to attend. The Task Force is also seeking nominations for various student, faculty, and staff awards; nominations are due by 5:00PM on Friday, May 10.

item.title: Appointments Now Available at COMM+D!
item.description: Are you working on a writing assignment, oral presentation, or visual design project? Whether you’re still in the initial brainstorming stages or finishing up your final revisions, the Center for Global Communication+Design can help, so schedule an appointment with a member of COMM+D’s trained staff today!

item.title: Faculty and Staff Climate Survey Closes Friday
item.description: The Faculty and Staff Climate Survey launched by email on April 2, and so far, we have approximately 43% of faculty and staff who have completed the survey, compared to over 70% who completed a similar survey in 2021. Strong participation ensures that Rensselaer is capturing the best possible picture of the university and can track changes over time, so all faculty and staff are encouraged to submit the completely anonymous survey by this Friday, May 10.

item.title: EMPAC to Host Gameful and Immersive Learning Symposium May 13-14
item.description: May 13-14, 2024 – Presented by EMPAC Research, this two-day symposium discusses innovative methods and technologies for teaching, offers invited talks by field experts and panel discussions with your RPI colleagues, and workshops for creating, curating, and facilitating these types of learning experiences. Registration closes May 10, 2024.
